revised_title: Frictional Properties of Plastics and Their Mechanism
tldr: The authors investigated the frictional properties of various linear polymers and found that the frictional force is proportional to the area of contact. They discovered that strong adhesion occurs between the surfaces, and shearing occurs within the bulk of the plastic rather than at the interface. This suggests that the mechanism of friction for plastics is similar to that proposed for metals. An exception to these findings is polytetrafluorethylene, which has a different frictional behavior.
